title: Facebook Chief Product Officer and WhatsApp VP leaving
text: Jen Rogers of Yahoo Finance reports on Mark Zuckerberg announcing Chris Cox Facebook Chief Product Officer and WhatsApp Vice President Chris Daniels are departing the company.  This news comes amid information that Facebook is under criminal investigation by the Feds for unauthorized data sharing of user information.

title: Facebook's Chief Product Officer to Leave Company
text: Facebook Inc. said on Thursday that Chief Product Officer Chris Cox is leaving, the highest-ranking executive to depart since the social-media giant became embroiled in crisis last year. Bloomberg's Sarah Frier reports on "Bloomberg Markets: What'd You Miss?"

title: Facebook's Chief Product Officer Chris Cox to leave company
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on Mark Zuckerberg's announcement that Facebook's Chief Product Officer Chris Cox will leave the company.

title: Facebook tempting fate with data deals, says former federal prosecutor
text: Katie Cherkasky, a former federal prosecutor, analyzes the criminal investigation into Facebook's data-sharing deals.

title: Judge Napolitano's take on college admissions scandal and Facebook investigation
text: Fox News senior judicial analyst Judge Andrew Napolitano on the fallout from the college admissions scandal and reports there is a criminal investigation into Facebook.

title: Facebook's fundamentals in tact despite scandals, says CFRA's Scott Kessler
text: Scott Kessler of CFRA discusses risks facing Facebook's stock.

title: Watch CNBC's exclusive interview with former Twitter CEO Dick Costolo
text: Dick Costolo, former Twitter CEO, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Facebook's ongoing privacy scandals, Sen. Elizabeth Warren's calls to break up some of the biggest tech companies and more.

title: Stock Market News: Facebook Takes Hits on 2 Fronts; Tesla Readies Model Y
text: Stocks finally paused after a long upward run.

title: Jim Cramer Breaks Down Facebook
text: Jim Cramer weighs in on the top headlines Thursday.

title: Feds conducting criminal investigating into Facebook over data sharing
text:
Jared Blikre of Yahoo Finance breaks down the details of the Federal investigation into Facebook for allegedly giving large tech companies access to user data. 
Kevin Kelly - Benchmark CEO along with Adam Shapiro, Julie Hyman and Brian Cheung discuss Facebook and the extent to which companies are using the data of users.

title: Report: Facebook Under Criminal Investigation
text: Social media platform Facebook, Inc. is reportedly facing a criminal investigation into deals it struck with technology companies, according to The New York Times.

title: ETF Spotlight: Tech sector on pace for fourth straight day of gains
text: CNBC's Dominic Chu takes a look at technology ETFs as the sector has shown strong performance in the market for the last four trading days.

title: Facebook Staring Down US Probe of Data Deals
text: Facebook Inc. is facing an investigation from federal prosecutors delving into its data deals with some of the world’s largest technology companies, according to the New York Times.

title: Facebook has been down for an hour, Instagram and Whatsapp also affected
text: Facebook acknowledged that users were reporting issues loading its family of apps Wednesday, which includes Instagram and WhatsApp.

title: Why Alan Patricof treats big tech stocks as utilities
text: Alan Patricof, founder and managing director at Greycroft LLC, sits down with "Squawk Box" to discuss some of the proposals to break up the big tech companies as well as the criminal investigation of Facebook's data deals.

title: Facebook faces criminal probe into data deals: NYT
text: At least two companies that make smartphones and other devices have received subpoenas from a New York grand jury related to how they used Facebook user data they received under deals with the social networking company.

title: Facebook, Google should be investigated for dominating digital advertising, UK finance minister says
text: U.K. Finance Minister Philip Hammond urged the Competition and Markets Authority to launch a review of Britain's digital advertising market.

title: Did Mark Zuckerberg Just Vaguebook All of Us With His Privacy Pitch?
text: The social media titan is going to get more serious about protecting users' data and allowing them more control over it. What might that look like? It's totally unclear.

title: Facebook employees have special hotlines to get faster customer support for their friends and family
text: Facebook has a special internal email hotline, commonly referred to as "Oops@", where employees can get priority support.

title: Facebook sites go down for some users
text: Facebook Inc.'s social-networking sites were not loading for all users around 1 p.m. Eastern time Wednesday.

title: Facebook Bans Zero Hedge Posts
text: Social media platform Facebook, Inc. is reportedly blocking users from sharing content originating from Zero Hedge, a financial news website that has a "bearish bent and anti-establishment" tone, read more

title: Zuckerberg's push to make posts private could cause more misinformation, says expert
text: Alex Stamos, NBC News cybersecurity analyst and former Facebook chief security officer, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss how social media companies are fighting the threat of fake news to India's upcoming election.

title: Social media companies aim to fight fake news ahead of India's election
text: U.S. social media companies are hoping to reduce the threat of misinformation for India's upcoming election. CNBC's Seema Mody reports.

title: Facebook's Empty Promises and a Bad Week For Eventbrite and Okta
text: Zuckerberg’s 3,000-word blog post about a strong commitment to privacy doesn’t ring true when you read between the lines.

title: Nomura: Buy Facebook
text: The "Halftime Report" traders debate Nomura's call to upgrade Facebook to buy

title: Need to Know: Why investors can’t count on Apple and Facebook to carry this stock market higher
text: Our call of the day, from Steve Grass, director of institutional sales at Stuart Frankel & Co., says investors cannot read too much into moves by big tech names Monday—in other words the all-clear hasn’t been sounded.

title: Facebook's Fake Pivot To Privacy
text: Mark Zuckerberg just made a lengthy announcement that has been described as a privacy pivot. Zuckerberg’s plan is a pragmatic move of a hyper-focused, obsessive CEO and little to do with privacy; it is not even a pivot; it appears tone-deaf as it gives ammunition to those who criticize Facebook.

title: Facebook temporarily deletes Elizabeth Warren’s ads that said it abuses its power
text: Facebook Inc. may have just proved Sen. Elizabeth Warren’s point.

title: Facebook Could Fall Into Traps With Privacy Pivot, EFF's Gebhart Says
text: Gennie Gebhart. EFF associate director of research, and Bloomberg Intelligence's Jitendra Waral discuss Facebook Inc.'s plan to rebuild features around privacy. They speak with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Google, Apple & Facebook are surging and here's why traders think it could be the missing link to this market
text: Super tech stocks surge. Is tech the missing market link? With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman, Brian Kelly and Steve Grasso.

title: Facebook upgraded by Nomura Instinet, boosting the shares
text: The firm also raised its price target on Facebook to $215 from $172. The stock was up 1.5 percent Monday in premarket trading to $172.10.

title: Will a New Cryptocurrency Save or Destroy Facebook?
text: Whether it’s Bitcoin or a myriad of other cryptocurrencies that have been available to the public, some crypto-hopefuls still predict massive upside in the years ahead in the world of cryptocurrencies.

title: Facebook's cryptocurrency could be a $19B revenue opportunity, Barclays says
text: Barclays sees major upside for Facebook if its secretive cryptocurrency plan works out.

title: Apple and Facebook Are About to Compete Like Never Before
text: The social networking specialist is suddenly a privacy champion.

title: This Just In: Facebook Stock Upgraded
text: Nomura thinks Stories and better engagement could push shares of the social networking titan higher.

title: Facebook Stock Raised To Buy As User-Engagement Fears Ease
text: Facebook stock jumped Monday after being upgraded to buy and having its price target raised by a Wall Street analyst who said concerns about waning user engagement have softened.

title: A Foolish Take: Pinterest Beats Facebook and Instagram in This Key Metric
text: This social network is a popular platform for product searches and shopping.

title: Nomura Instinet Upgrades Facebook, Says More Regulation Will Be 'Net Positive'
text: Nomura Instinet upgraded Facebook, Inc.,  saying the social media platform is transitioning to its new “Stories” format faster than originally thought.

title: Kara Swisher says Facebook just shoplifted Snap's best idea
text: Recode Co-Founder Kara Swisher joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Facebook's potential pivot to privacy, how the company could expand and more.
